text: Caló is a dialect spoken by the Gitanos or Zincarli (also calés, "dark ones") that came to Spain. Caló uses Romani vocabulary with Spanish grammar, Ethnologue as Spanish Roma lost the full use of their ancestral language.The situation of Roma in Spain The language is mainly used for private talking between Roma people. == Notes and references == == Other websites == *Calo *Romani Language Category:Indo-Aryan languages Category:Roma
title: Caló language
